title: Movie Font Casablanca
content:
Hello

I am looking for the font that is used in the movie 'Casablanca'  
Can anyone please tell me?

TIA  
Nicolien

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [casablanca.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415130436/http:/typophile.com/files/casablanca.pdf) | 283.64 KB |
author: NvdK

comments.content:
Most of the movie titles were hand-lettered in that era, and I think that's the case also with Casablanca.

Would you settle with something similiar-looking?
Do you know a font that is coming close to this font? It would be fine.

That one might be fit well:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/blakely/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415130436/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/blakely/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/blakely/")

Hi SIm,

It is not what I am looking at, but thanks anyway.
That's what I thought but I'd find this typeface had relationship with Casablanca.

Thanks for the plug, André.

I can't think of anything really close, but here are a couple from Letterhead Fonts that have a similar feel:

[http://letterheadfonts.com/contributors/garygodby/brien.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415130436/http:/letterheadfonts.com/contributors/garygodby/brien.shtml "http://letterheadfonts.com/contributors/garygodby/brien.shtml")

[http://www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/chuckdavis/matthewsthin.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415130436/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/chuckdavis/matthewsthin.shtml "http://www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/chuckdavis/matthewsthin.shtml")

Hi Mark

Thanks a lot. It is not the same as you already mention, but the Brien comes very close.

This is the one I gone use.

Thanks again!  
Nicolien
